title: Italian Tiramisu

override.half: 2 tbsp cocoa powder (Rodelle is my favorite)

steps: Brew the espresso and let it cool. For the best tasting tiramisu, choose high quality fresh coffee beans.
Separate the egg yolks and egg whites. Place the egg yolks in a ^large bowl$, and the egg whites in a ^medium steel bowl$.
Place a ^medium saucepan$ on the stove, and add water and sugar. Cook the mixture over medium heat until the sugar is fully dissolved and it comes to a boil. Remove from heat.

Beat the egg yolks just until the yolks are broken up using a ^hand mixer$. While mixing, slowly drizzle in half of the sugar syrup into the mixture. Beat the mixture until it turns pale yellow and doubles in volume.
Add the mascarpone cheese a few tablespoons at a time. Continue beating until a smooth consistency is achieved.

In the medium bowl with the egg whites, begin beating the egg whites using a cleaned hand mixer. Beat until it begins to get slightly frothy. Slowly drizzle in the remaining sugar syrup while beating. Beat until stiff peaks are formed.

Fold in about â…” of the egg white mixture into the egg yolk mixture. Add in small portions until desired consistency. Do not use all as it can become too liquid. Try to be as gentle as possible to not crush the light texture of the egg whites.
Put the cream mixture in the fridge for at least half an hour.
Add the espresso into a ^shallow dish$. Quickly dip a ladyfinger into the espresso and place in a ^8x8 inch square pan$. Create one layer of ladyfingers.
Spread half the cream mixture on top using an ^offset spatula$. Repeat a layer of ladyfingers then cream.
Dust the top of the tiramisu with the cocoa powder using a ^sieve$.

Refrigerate overnight before serving. This will help the flavors all come together and soak in. If you would like to get the striped design cut some parchment paper into small strips, place on top of the cream and then dust with cocoa.
